name: Student Share Room
text: Tiny, cheap, and noisy — perfect for term time.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 25,000. Rent: 200. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: Student Share Room. If you buy it pay $25,000 cash (or take loan). It yields $200 rent each rent-collection phase. High risk: more likely to be affected by eviction/market events.

name: Tiny Home
text: Compact living with low overheads and surprising charm.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 40,000. Rent: 300. Risk: low.
explanation: Property: Tiny Home. Buy for $40,000. Generates $300 rent per rent-collection. Low risk: resilient to some crises (e.g., floods may not affect).

name: Studio Unit
text: Compact studio in a busy precinct — steady renters.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 80,000. Rent: 450. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: Studio Unit. Buy for $80,000; yields $450 rent each collection. High risk implies vulnerability to market swings and event cards.

name: Run-down Duplex
text: Needs TLC but has income potential if you gamble.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 120,000. Rent: 700. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: Run-down Duplex. Buy for $120,000; yields $700 rent. High-risk property: may be lost or heavily devalued during certain events.

name: Two-bed Apartment
text: Popular with small families and professionals.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 200,000. Rent: 1,200. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Two-bed Apartment. Buy for $200,000; yields $1,200 rent. Medium risk: balanced return and exposure.

name: Suburban 3BR
text: A family favourite outside the city centre.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 350,000. Rent: 1,500. Risk: low.
explanation: Property: Suburban 3BR. Buy for $350,000; yields $1,500 rent. Low risk: lower volatility, safer in crises.

name: High-rise Condo
text: Sleek skyline living — expensive but desirable.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 420,000. Rent: 2,200. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: High-rise Condo. Buy for $420,000; yields $2,200 rent. High risk: strong value swings in a crash.

name: Renovated Terrace
text: Stylish, renovated inner-city terrace with steady tenants.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 430,000. Rent: 2,300. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Renovated Terrace. Buy for $430,000; yields $2,300 rent. Medium risk indicates decent resilience and income.

name: Victorian House
text: Heritage charm, pricey to maintain but priceless to some.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 500,000. Rent: 2,500. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Victorian House. Buy for $500,000; yields $2,500 rent. Medium risk: maintenance events may cost more.

name: Renovated Duplex
text: Two units updated with modern interiors.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 260,000. Rent: 1,300. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Renovated Duplex. Buy for $260,000; yields $1,300 rent. Balanced medium risk and good income for mid-tier players.

name: Suburban Townhouse
text: Reliable, close to schools and parks.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 310,000. Rent: 1,400. Risk: low.
explanation: Property: Suburban Townhouse. Buy for $310,000; yields $1,400 rent. Low risk: stable rent and resistance to some crises.

name: Coastal Bungalow
text: Nice view, tempting renters — watch weather risks.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 380,000. Rent: 1,800. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Coastal Bungalow. Buy for $380,000; yields $1,800 rent. Medium risk; some crises (flood/storm) may affect value.

name: Gentrified Studio
text: Small but with trendy rents — boom-or-bust vibes.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 160,000. Rent: 900. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: Gentrified Studio. Buy for $160,000; yields $900 rent. High risk due to market sensitivity.

name: Warehouse Conversion Loft
text: Hip lofts attract higher rents for creatives.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 290,000. Rent: 1,600. Risk: high.
explanation: Property: Warehouse Conversion Loft. Buy for $290,000; yields $1,600 rent. High risk but strong rental when market favors urban dwellers.

name: Country Cottage
text: Peaceful backyard, less demand but loyal tenants.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 220,000. Rent: 1,000. Risk: low.
explanation: Property: Country Cottage. Buy for $220,000; yields $1,000 rent. Low risk and useful for stable income.

name: Luxury Penthouse
text: Top-floor lavish living — huge upside, big downside if market drops.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 1,200,000. Rent: 8,000. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Luxury Penthouse. Buy for $1,200,000; yields $8,000 rent. Medium risk but expensive: requires strong cash or loans.

name: Mixed-use Corner Block
text: Shops below, apartments above — diverse income streams.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 680,000. Rent: 3,200. Risk: medium.
explanation: Property: Mixed-use Corner Block. Buy for $680,000; yields $3,200 rent. Mixed revenue sources reduce some single-market risk.

name: Affordable Housing Unit
text: Lower returns but government-backed stability.
effect: Buyable property. Price: 150,000. Rent: 750. Risk: low.
explanation: Property: Affordable Housing Unit. Buy for $150,000; yields $750 rent. Low risk and may be exempt or cushioned in some crises.

name: Interest Rate Hike (Local)
text: The central bank nudges rates up — households flinch.
effect: All players' outstanding debt increases by 10% (instant).
explanation: Event: Interest Rate Hike. Immediately increase each player's debt total by 10% (round to nearest $100). Apply once on event resolution.

name: Community Garden Initiative
text: Neighbors come together — happier tenants.
effect: Each player receives +500 cash (local goodwill).
explanation: Event: Community Garden. Add $500 cash to every player's cash balance. Represents improved neighbourhood/community benefits.

name: Eviction Notice
text: A legal eviction affects one of your rented units.
effect: Choose a player with properties; they lose one random property (discarded).
explanation: Event: Eviction Notice. Select a player with at least one property; that player discards a randomly chosen property (it returns to discard pile).

name: First Home Grant
text: Subsidy to encourage new buyers enters the market.
effect: Next property purchase by the drawing player is 10% cheaper (single-use).
explanation: Event: First Home Grant. The player who draws this card receives a 10% discount on their next property purchase only; then discount clears.

name: Unexpected Maintenance
text: Pipe bursts — urgent repairs required.
effect: Pay $7,500 cash or lose one property's rent this round.
explanation: Event: Unexpected Maintenance. The drawing player must either pay $7,500 from cash (if possible) or mark one owned property as non-income this round (no rent collected from it).

name: Renovation Boom
text: A surge in local renovations increases values.
effect: Choose one owned property: +15% value and +10% rent (immediate).
explanation: Event: Renovation Boom. The drawing player selects one of their properties; increase its value by 15% and rent by 10% immediately (round values).

name: Neighborhood Protest
text: Residents protest proposed development — uncertain outcomes.
effect: All players: roll a die; on 1-2 lose $2,000; on 3-4 no change; 5-6 gain $2,000.
explanation: Event: Neighborhood Protest. Each player rolls 1d6; results: 1-2 pay $2,000; 3-4 nothing; 5-6 receive $2,000. Simulates local volatility.

name: Tenant Strike
text: Rent collection is disrupted for a building.
effect: Choose one player's property: that property yields no rent this round.
explanation: Event: Tenant Strike. The drawing player picks a target property owned by any player; that property provides no rent in the next rent-collection phase.

name: Landlord Sells
text: A previous owner sells — tenant relocation required.
effect: Drawing player must discard one property they own or pay $10,000 to keep it.
explanation: Event: Landlord Sells. The drawing player decides to either discard one of their properties to the discard pile or pay $10,000 to retain it (if they have the cash).

name: Local Development Approval
text: New development approved nearby — values shift.
effect: All property prices reduce by 8% for valuation purposes (one-time modifier).
explanation: Event: Local Development Approval. Immediately multiply all property values by 0.92 (reduce by 8%). This affects future rent and net worth calculations.

name: Renters' Union
text: Stronger renter protections reduce evictions.
effect: For next 2 rounds, Eviction-related events cannot force property loss.
explanation: Event: Renters' Union. Set game flag protecting properties from eviction events for two full rounds; track remaining rounds.

name: Inspection Fine
text: Failed inspection results in a fine.
effect: Drawing player pays $5,000 fine.
explanation: Event: Inspection Fine. Immediately subtract $5,000 from the drawing player's cash (if cash insufficient they may take loan or accept debt consequences).

name: Pop-up Cafe Opens
text: Local amenity improves desirability slightly.
effect: Owner of one adjacent property (player's choice) gets +200 rent this round.
explanation: Event: Pop-up Cafe. The drawing player chooses any single property in play; its owner receives an extra $200 during the next rent collection.

name: Insurance Payout
text: An insured property gets a payout after damage.
effect: Drawing player receives $12,000 cash (one-off).
explanation: Event: Insurance Payout. Add $12,000 to the drawing player's cash balance. Represents claim recovery for prior loss.

name: Green Retrofit Grant
text: Government offers subsidy for energy upgrades.
effect: Reduce price of renovating a property by $7,500 for this player (one-time use).
explanation: Event: Green Retrofit Grant. The drawing player may apply a $7,500 discount to the next renovation action they perform on a property.

name: Short-term Letting Spike
text: Tourism season boosts short-term rental income.
effect: Choose one property you own: +50% rent for next rent-collection phase.
explanation: Event: Short-term Letting Spike. The drawing player selects one of their properties; its rent is increased by 50% for the next rent collection only.

name: Developer Fails to Deliver
text: A developer delays completion — investors uneasy.
effect: All players' property values decrease by 5% this round.
explanation: Event: Developer Fails to Deliver. Multiply all players' property values by 0.95 (reduce by 5%); apply immediately.

name: Community Volunteer Project
text: Local goodwill leads to minor tax breaks.
effect: Drawing player reduces debt interest due this round by $2,000 (one-off).
explanation: Event: Community Volunteer Project. Subtract $2,000 from interest or debt obligations for the drawing player for the current round.

name: Zoning Change
text: Zoning reclassification may open redevelopment options.
effect: Pick one of your properties: you may flip it into a higher-tier property (+25% value) or keep it as-is.
explanation: Event: Zoning Change. The drawing player chooses one property they own and decides whether to increase its value by 25% (representing redevelopment) or leave it unchanged.

name: Local Business Closes
text: Loss of amenity reduces desirability in the area.
effect: Choose one player's property: reduce its value by 10% (one-time).
explanation: Event: Local Business Closes. The drawing player targets any single property owned by any player and reduces its value by 10% immediately.

name: Take Loan
text: Inject cash now; pay later with interest.
effect: Gain $30,000 cash instantly; debt +30,000.
explanation: Action: Take Loan. Immediately add $30,000 to your cash and increase your debt by $30,000. Debt may accrue interest during crises.

name: Renovate
text: Invest to increase value and rent.
effect: Choose one property you own: +20% value, +20% rent (pay cost of renovation = 10% of property's value).
explanation: Action: Renovate. Pick one owned property. Pay renovation cost equal to 10% of that property's current value (from your cash). If you pay, increase that property's value by 20% and rent by 20% immediately.

name: Quick Fix
text: Small repairs to avoid fines and keep tenants happy.
effect: Pay $3,000 to prevent the next maintenance fine on one property you own.
explanation: Action: Quick Fix. Pay $3,000 cash to protect one chosen property from the next 'maintenance' or inspection fine event that would affect it.

name: Rent Increase
text: Raise rents where possible for a short-term boost.
effect: All your properties gain +10% rent for the next rent-collection phase.
explanation: Action: Rent Increase. For the next rent-collection phase only, multiply your properties' rents by 1.10. This effect lasts one rent collection.

name: Offer Renovation Loan (Haven)
text: Offer tenants an improvement plan that also increases value.
effect: Pick one property: pay $5,000 to increase its value by 12% and rent by 8%.
explanation: Action: Offer Renovation Loan. Pay $5,000 now to get a 12% property value increase and 8% rent increase on a selected owned property immediately.

name: Evade Tax (Risky)
text: Try your luck avoiding taxes — risky but tempting.
effect: 50% chance nothing happens; 50% chance pay $15,000 fine.
explanation: Action: Evade Tax. Flip a coin (or roll); on success no effect; on failure subtract $15,000 from your cash immediately.

name: Insurance Policy
text: Buy insurance to protect against a single loss event.
effect: Pay $6,000 now; the next property loss event affecting you is ignored and you are compensated $10,000 instead.
explanation: Action: Insurance Policy. Pay $6,000 to activate protection. The next time you would lose a property to an event, you instead keep the property and receive $10,000 compensation (apply effect and consume this insurance).

name: Subsidized Loan
text: Government loans with lower immediate interest.
effect: Take $50,000 loan; debt +50,000 but interest in next interest-hike crisis is halved for this loan.
explanation: Action: Subsidized Loan. Add $50,000 to your cash and debt. In future 'interest hike' events, treat half of this loan's debt as exempt for the interest calculation.

name: Sell Property
text: Flip a property for cash at its current value (minus 5% fees).
effect: Choose one owned property: sell for current value minus 5% fee, add to your cash, property removed.
explanation: Action: Sell Property. Remove the chosen property from your holdings and add its value * 0.95 to your cash (sell fee).

name: Bridge Funding
text: Short-term bridge to cover a purchase gap.
effect: Temporarily receive $15,000; must repay within two rounds or pay $3,000 penalty per overdue round.
explanation: Action: Bridge Funding. Grant $15,000 to your cash immediately. Track repayment: if not repaid within two full rounds, apply $3,000 penalty per overdue round until repaid.

name: Community Outreach
text: Invest time to reduce risk and improve tenant stability.
effect: For the next two rounds, one of your properties is protected from eviction and yields +200 rent each round.
explanation: Action: Community Outreach. Choose one property you own to gain tenant stability for two rounds: it will not be affected by eviction events and gains +$200 rent each round for that period.

name: Buy-to-Rent Strategy
text: Buy a property and pre-lease it to guarantee income.
effect: When you play this action, you may purchase any property in your hand at 95% of price and it yields +10% rent for the next 3 rounds.
explanation: Action: Buy-to-Rent Strategy. You may immediately buy a property from your hand at a 5% discount (pay price*0.95). The purchased property's rent is increased by 10% for the next three rent collection phases.

name: Market Crash
text: Sudden crash slashes property values across the board.
effect: All property values drop by 40% (multiply by 0.6).
explanation: Crisis: Market Crash. On resolution, set each owned property's value to value * 0.6 (round to nearest $100). This is a global, immediate change.

name: Interest Rate Spike
text: Debt becomes more expensive overnight.
effect: All players' debt increases by 10% (add 10% of debt to the debt).
explanation: Crisis: Interest Rate Spike. Increase each player's current debt by 10% (rounded). This represents immediate interest accrual or repricing.

name: Rent Freeze
text: Policy halts rent collection for a period.
effect: No rent is collected during the next rent-collection phase.
explanation: Crisis: Rent Freeze. For the next scheduled rent collection, do not collect any rents. After that phase the freeze ends.

name: Government Stimulus
text: Direct payments to households to relieve pressure.
effect: Each player receives $10,000 cash.
explanation: Crisis: Government Stimulus. Immediately add $10,000 to every player's cash balance.

name: Natural Disaster (Flood)
text: Floods damage low-lying properties — expensive consequences.
effect: All 'coastal' or 'low-lying' flagged properties lose 50% value; owners may pay $20,000 per property to fully repair (preventing value loss).
explanation: Crisis: Natural Disaster (Flood). Target properties with flood exposure (implementer: mark some properties as flood-prone). If owner pays $20,000 per affected property immediately, its value is preserved; otherwise reduce value by 50%.

name: Developer Collapse
text: A major developer goes bankrupt, halting projects and confidence.
effect: All players' property values drop by 15% this round.
explanation: Crisis: Developer Collapse. Multiply all property values by 0.85 immediately. This is a global negative modifier applied once.

name: Eviction Moratorium
text: A temporary law blocks evictions and protects tenants.
effect: For 2 rounds, players cannot lose properties to eviction events; some eviction events have no effect.
explanation: Crisis: Eviction Moratorium. Set a protection flag for two rounds preventing event cards that would force property removal from taking effect.

name: Foreign Investment Surge
text: A wave of outside capital pushes prices up temporarily.
effect: All property values increase by 20% (multiply by 1.2).
explanation: Crisis: Foreign Investment Surge. Immediately multiply each owned property's value by 1.2, reflecting upward market pressure.

name: Regulatory Reform
text: New rules change subsidies and tax benefits.
effect: Players with debt > 0 pay a one-off $5,000 processing fee; affordable properties gain +8% value.
explanation: Crisis: Regulatory Reform. Charge each player with positive debt a $5,000 fee (subtract from cash). Then increase values of properties flagged as 'affordable' by 8% (implementer: map some properties).

name: Wage Shock
text: Wages fall, reducing household spending power.
effect: All players collect 15% less rent during the next rent collection.
explanation: Crisis: Wage Shock. For the next rent-collection phase only, reduce all rent collection amounts by multiplying by 0.85.

name: Pop-up Artist Collective
text: Short-term creative energy raises rents in a small pocket.
effect: Select one property: +300 rent this round.
explanation: Event: Pop-up Artist Collective. The drawing player chooses a single property; that property receives an extra $300 for the upcoming rent collection phase.

name: Housing Pitch Competition
text: You pitch a plan — investors are impressed.
effect: Drawing player receives $8,000 cash.
explanation: Event: Housing Pitch Competition. Immediately add $8,000 to the drawing player's cash as if they secured small investment.

name: Squatter Settlement
text: Unofficial occupants reduce rental income unpredictably.
effect: Choose one opponent: that player loses 50% of one property's rent next round.
explanation: Event: Squatter Settlement. The drawing player selects an opponent; that opponent chooses a property that will produce only half its usual rent next collection.

name: Tax Break for Landlords
text: A temporary tax reduction benefits owners.
effect: Drawing player reduces debt by $4,000 (tax credit) or receives $4,000 cash instead (player's choice).
explanation: Event: Tax Break for Landlords. The drawing player chooses whether to apply a $4,000 reduction to their debt or receive $4,000 in cash.

name: Media Scandal
text: A negative story hits — public perception matters.
effect: Choose any player's property: -12% value immediately.
explanation: Event: Media Scandal. The drawing player selects a property owned by any player and reduces its value by 12% (immediate).

name: Charity Donation
text: You donate to local causes and build goodwill.
effect: Drawing player loses $2,000 but can ignore next eviction event targeting them.
explanation: Event: Charity Donation. Deduct $2,000 now. Set a one-time protection that prevents the next eviction-based property loss from affecting the drawing player.

name: Price Discovery
text: A valuation suggests your property is underpriced.
effect: Choose one owned property: +12% value (instant).
explanation: Event: Price Discovery. The drawing player chooses one of their properties and increases its current value by 12% immediately.

name: Repair Scam
text: A dodgy contractor takes your money and does nothing.
effect: Pay $6,000 or lose one property's next rent collection.
explanation: Event: Repair Scam. The drawing player must either pay $6,000 or choose one of their properties that will not produce rent in the upcoming collection.

name: Community Hub Opens
text: A new hub helps tenants find part-time work.
effect: All players receive +300 cash this round.
explanation: Event: Community Hub. Add $300 to every player's cash instantly. Represents local economic uplift.

name: Speculator Drops Out
text: A big buyer pulls back — prices wobble.
effect: Randomly choose one property in play: -10% value.
explanation: Event: Speculator Drops Out. Choose at random a property currently owned by any player and reduce its value by 10%.

name: Crowdfund Improvement
text: Raise small funds from the community to upgrade a property.
effect: Raise $10,000 from community; use it on one property to increase value by 10% (no cash cost to player).
explanation: Action: Crowdfund Improvement. Immediately add $10,000 designated to a chosen property; increase that property's value by 10% without deducting player cash.

name: Lease Guarantee
text: Provide a guarantee to secure a tenant quickly.
effect: One property you buy next turn yields guaranteed rent of +500 for its first rent-collection phase.
explanation: Action: Lease Guarantee. The next property you purchase will yield an extra $500 on its first rent collection.

name: Bulk Sale
text: Sell two properties at once at 92% combined value.
effect: Choose two owned properties: sell both for combined (value * 0.92) and add to cash.
explanation: Action: Bulk Sale. Remove two chosen properties from your holdings and add 92% of their total combined value to your cash (fees included).

name: Community Housing Partnership
text: Partner with a non-profit for stable income.
effect: Pick one owned property: it yields +400 rent each round for next 3 rounds, but cannot be sold during that period.
explanation: Action: Community Housing Partnership. Choose a property to lock into partnership for three rounds: it yields an extra $400 per round and is unsellable until the period ends.

name: Reassess Portfolio
text: Take time to reorganize and reduce risk.
effect: Choose up to two properties you own: reduce each's risk level by one step (high→medium or medium→low).
explanation: Action: Reassess Portfolio. For up to two properties, lower their risk classification by one level (e.g., high to medium). Useful to protect against future crises.

name: Short Sell Speculator
text: Bet against a property — payoff if market drops.
effect: If the next crisis reduces property values, gain 10% of your targeted property's pre-crash value; otherwise pay 5% of its value.
explanation: Action: Short Sell Speculator. Choose a target property. If the next crisis reduces overall property values, you gain a payout equal to 10% of that property's pre-crisis value; if no value drop occurs in the next crisis, you pay 5% of its value (representing a failed bet).

name: Emergency Repair
text: Stopgap measure to avoid losing a property.
effect: Pay $12,000 to prevent a property loss that would occur this round.
explanation: Action: Emergency Repair. Immediately spend $12,000 to negate an event in the same round that would otherwise cause you to lose a property.

name: Lobby for Change
text: Influence local policy for a short benefit.
effect: Roll a die: on 4-6 get a policy result that gives you $8,000; on 1-3 pay $4,000 in lobbying costs (no other effect).
explanation: Action: Lobby for Change. Roll 1d6; if result is 4-6, add $8,000 to your cash (successful lobbying); if 1-3, subtract $4,000 (failed attempt).

name: Tenant Mediation
text: Resolve tenant disputes to avoid costly evictions.
effect: Cancel the next eviction event targeting you and gain +300 rent on that property next round.
explanation: Action: Tenant Mediation. Neutralize the next eviction or tenant-loss event aimed at you and grant +$300 rent on the affected property for the next rent collection.

name: Affordable Housing Grant (Apply)
text: Apply for a grant to convert a property to affordable housing.
effect: If accepted (50% chance), convert one property to 'affordable' status: +8% value and receives special protections in some crises; if rejected, pay $2,000 application fee.
explanation: Action: Affordable Housing Grant. Flip 1d2: on success mark chosen property as 'affordable' (value +8% and some crisis protections); on failure subtract $2,000 from cash.
